intro: Notylia stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved notylia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Notylia stenantha plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
